posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
I mentioned this gal to Orion so thought I'd post it for your perusal.  Feel free to make any and all suggestions except for adding a third class.  Won't happen  :)

Having grown up playing D&D from the original blue boxed set, I have always had a fondness for the dual classed character.  A Fighter/Magicuser.  But NWN seems to push us more towards three classes just to get all the goodies....  But some times I just feel a bit rebellious.

This gal is a dual classed Barb/Sorc.  This was done on purpose.  Yes, she could have taken 4 less sorc levels and mixed in rogue for a nice skill set, or Ftr for more feats, etc.  But she is a lot of fun as she is and there is still a bit of room for customization.  For instance, I didn't take Improved Knockdown as I had Bigsby's.    As she uses a scimitar, feel free to drop Improved Crit for Improved knockdown.  I took Craft Wand and Scribe Scroll as WoG is a rest restricted server.  If yours isn't, feel free to drop those for the Spell Penetration feats and then drop the Epic Mummy for Epic Penetration.

I will say this though... it is a whole lot of fun to Improved Invis into a group of foes and go all Terrifying Rage on them... then while they run around like chickens with their heads cut off, you blast em with spells or take their heads literally.  Intimidate is almost maxed, and Skill Focused and Charisma just makes it better.  And while not a monk,she does get a tiny speed boost.

I don't have a skill leveling chart on this text file, but I'll grab one and put it up in a day or so when I get access to my machine at home.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi conlaoch. Others will comment on the sorcerous qualities of this build, but I'd just like to throw my two bits in on the other stuff. That said, does that 24th level of Sorcerer trump the extra 1/- DR from 17 Barb? (Genuine question.)

But more importantly, what is it with you Wogglers (Woggies, Woggers, etc)? Pay some attention to the early stuff! Knockdown at level 1? Really? And your chances of landing one? Come on, don't dis the pre-epics!

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content: LOL...  had to think of something a barb could take at level 1.   So swap it with Blind Fight  :)  though at level one you probably wont be coming across too many invisible opponents.   Except for Improved Critical, none of the rest can be taken until a Sorc level is taken.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Blind Fight would be my choice, too, my friend. And then, after some good cask proof stuff, Fall Down, sorry, Knock. Ah, maybe both would work.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
re: "why sorcerer and not Wizard?"    mainly because Intimidate was affected by Charisma so the caster ability would help feed the Rage.

and the idea of a charismatic barbarian seemed like an interesting idea...

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Wizard would give a bunch more skill points and more feats.  And Scribe Scroll is then received for free.  So it would allow the Spell penetration line, or a spell focus line easily enough.  1 from the saved Scribe and then two bonus feats...  and You'd still have 2 more bonus feats left over from wiz 20.   

I find the idea of a charismatic barbarian a bit easier to swallow then a studious one  :)    but as my grandma used to say   "To each their own. said the Lady as she kissed  a cow..."
